Author: Qu
Dex Dose Raw Comments:
A nighttime dose of placebo or dexmedetomidine (1 μg/
kg over 40 min, maximal dose of 80 μg) was administered intravenously following extubation on the night of surgery and subsequently every night throughout the CSICU stay for up 3 days postoperatively.

Author: Momeni
Dex Dose Raw Comments:
Propofol infusion and dexmedetomidine 0.4 μg/kg/h

Propofol: 1-3 mg/kg/hour
DEX: rate of 5ml/h with a correstomiding infusion at a rate of 5 ml/h corresponding to 0.4 μg/kg/h

Author: Likhvantsev
Dex Dose Raw Comments:
The infusion rate was fixed at 0.7 μg/kg/h in the operating room starting at anesthesia induction. 
- without bolous or loading dose
- lasted until ventilation weaning in ICU

In the ICU the starting dose was 0.4 mg/kg/h,
with a possible range of infusion of 0.4 to 1.4 mg/kg/h

Author: Turan
Dex Dose Raw Comments:
Dexmedetomidine infusion, without a bolus dose
Dex rate of 0.1 μg/kg/h at the end of bypass, the dose was increased to 0.2 μg/kg/h. Post­operatively, dexmedetomidine was increased to 0.4 μg/kg/h which was maintained until 24 h after the infusion began.

Author: Subramaniam
Dex Dose Raw Comments: The dexmedetomidine group received an IV bolus dose of 0.5 to 1 μg/kg during chest closure, followed by a maintenance infusion of 0.1 to 1.4 μg/kg per hour

Author: Li
Dex Dose Raw Comments:
Dexmedetomidine hydrochloride 200 μg /2 ml
diluted in saline

Dexmedetomidine the final concentration was 4 μg/ml.

Study drug infusion was started once the intravenous access was established, firstly at a rate of [0.9 × kg] ml/h (i.e.,0.6 μg/kg for dexmedetomidine) for 10 minutes, then at a rate of [0.1 × kg] ml/h (i.e.,
0.4 μg/kg/h for dexmedetomidine) until the end of surgery. After surgery, study drug infusion was continued at a rate of [0.025 × kg] ml/h (i.e., 0.1 μg/kg/h for dexmedetomidine) until the end of mechanical ventilation.

Author: Djaiani
Dex Dose Raw Comments:
Upon arrival to ICU, patients in the dexmedetomidine group received a bolus of 0.4 μg/kg dexmedetomidine (over a period of 10 to 20min) followed by an
infusion of 0.2 to 0.7 μg kg−1 h−1.

If patients were hemodynamically unstable, the bolus dose was omitted. The infusion of dexmedetomidine was continued for a maximum period of 24h.

Dexmedetomidine infusion was not discontinued
before extubation.

Author: Shehabi
Dex Dose Raw Comments:
Dexmedetomidine prepared at a concentration of 0.1μg/kg/ml

Infusion at 3ml/h

Dex dose:  0.1–0.7μg/kg/h

Author: Soh
Dex Dose Raw Comments: Dexmedetomidine at a concentration of 4 mg/ml  was continuously infused at a rate of 0.4 mg/kg/h for 24 h starting immediately after anaesthetic induction.

Author: Chitnis
Dex Dose Raw Comments:
Dex

maintenance infusion starting at 0.5 mg/kg/h. This was titrated as required from 0 to 1.5 mg/kg/h.
